entries.content: Starting task: Fix text animation problem in claude-code-indicator.html. Moti wants a standalone HTML file in the same folder using production files for testing without reopening VS Code. Need to identify the animation issue and create a self-contained test file.

Found all production files:
- HTML: claude-code-indicator.html (line 19: shimmer-text animation)
- CSS: shimmer-text-base.css (base animation), shimmer-text-claude.css (Claude gradient), ui-indicator.css (DNA layout), ui-indicator-claude.css (Claude colors)
- Animation issue: shimmer-text uses background-clip text with gradient sweep animation
- Need to create standalone HTML with all CSS inlined for testing without reopening VS Code

Created claude-code-indicator-test.html with:
- All production CSS inlined (no external dependencies)
- Interactive test controls (text change, speed adjust, play/pause)
- Debugging info panel with common issues
- Complete shimmer-text + DNA helix animations
- JavaScript controls for testing different states
File location: same folder as original template for easy access

ISSUE FOUND: background-clip: text making text invisible. The shimmer-text animation uses background-clip to apply gradient to text, but when gradient doesn't render properly, text becomes completely transparent due to -webkit-text-fill-color: transparent. Need fallback strategy.

FIXED: background-clip text issue. Solution: Use pseudo-element (::before) overlay with data-text attribute. Base element has solid color fallback (#ff7043), pseudo-element has gradient with background-clip. This ensures text is always visible even if background-clip fails, while shimmer effect is applied as an overlay layer.

MISTAKE: My pseudo-element solution requires data-text attribute which breaks existing production templates. Need simpler solution that works with existing HTML structure - just fix the CSS to ensure text is visible while shimmer animates.

BETTER FIX: Changed gradient from transparent to solid orange (#ff7043) colors. Instead of fading to transparent (which makes text invisible), gradient now sweeps from base orange → lighter orange (#ff9770) → bright highlight (#ffe0d5) → back to orange. This way text is ALWAYS visible, shimmer effect creates a brightness sweep instead of transparency sweep. Works with existing HTML - no data-text needed!
Back to original issue: shimmer-text is invisible. Need to fix the PRODUCTION CSS files (shimmer-text-base.css and shimmer-text-claude.css) to make text visible while keeping shimmer effect.

Screenshot shows text still invisible - just seeing orange bar. The shimmer-text class is rendering but text content not visible. Need different approach - maybe the gradient isn't applying correctly with background-clip: text.

SHIMMER TEXT FIX COMPLETE ✓
Problem: background-clip: text made text invisible due to transparent gradient stops (transparent 100%)
Solution: Changed gradient to use ONLY solid opaque colors - no transparency
- Gradient: #ff7043 (base orange) → #ffe0d5 (bright highlight) → #ff7043 (back to orange)
- Removed "transparent 100%" stop
- Kept color: #ff7043 as fallback
- Animation sweeps brightness across text instead of transparency
- Text is ALWAYS visible, shimmer creates light sweep effect
Files modified:
- shimmer-text-base.css: removed "color: transparent"
- shimmer-text-claude.css: changed gradient to solid colors only
Result: Text visible with working shimmer animation

HOW TO HIDE/SHOW CONFIRMATION BOX:

Location: PermissionDisplayManager.js

SHOW:
container.style.display = 'block';

HIDE:
container.style.display = 'none';

The container is the confirmation dialog element retrieved via:
const container = this.domElements.get('confirmationContainer');

State Machine Flow (StateChangeHandler.js):
- 'pending' → show dialog (displayManager.show())
- 'processing' → keep hidden
- 'resolved' → hide dialog (displayManager.hide())
- 'idle' → ensure hidden (displayManager.hide())

Key files:
- PermissionDisplayManager.js: show() and hide() methods
- StateChangeHandler.js: handles state transitions
- Uses simple display: block/none for visibility

Fixed flash of confirmation box on VS Code load. Added style="display: none;" to confirm-box.html template. This prevents the box from being visible during initial page render before JavaScript takes control. The PermissionDisplayManager will still show it with display: block when needed.

Applied same shimmer text fix to codex CSS. Changed gradient from transparent rgba values to solid green colors (#10a37f → #9ae6d5 bright highlight → #10a37f). Now both Claude (orange) and Codex (green) indicators have working shimmer text with no invisible text issues.
